page.title: 13Wildlife at Weare School
page.content: When Weare School was first built the field was full of rushes. There were a few trees but very little else growing.We decided that we ought to have more trees and so parts of the field were dug and saplings were planted.We now have fully grown willows,poplars, birch, alder and ash trees. Then we decided to have a special area for nature. We planted some long grass for the insects and made a rockery for the snails and other creatures. We made a pond and put in lilies, water beetles, water snails and tadpoles. We tried to attract butterflies by planting shrubs that caterpillars could feed on. We have supplied bird feeders and nesting boxes for all sorts of birds even the tawny owl. The bees are buzzing now on the bushes and our school field is full of life.
